Comment: I shudder to think about what we would’ve been looking at if the movement to privatize Social Security Insurance in the 1980s had been successful. I know right now we are looking at it disappearing all together, but if our Social Security payments would have been subject to the ups and downs of the market, I don’t think it would be here now.    The more politicians call it “an entitlement” as a pejorative the more I feel like they want it to be a tax for working but want the insurance illusion to stand so we continue to pay it.
Author: GivMHellVetica
